The series, aired over three consecutive nights, focuses on the investigation into historical sex crimes committed by disc jockey [[Ray Teret]], and his subsequent trial and conviction for those offences.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2015/may/12/police-investigation-of-dj-sex-offender-ray-teret-shown-in-bbc2-documentary|title=Police investigation of DJ sex offender Ray Teret shown in BBC2 documentary|first=John|last=Plunkett|date=11 May 2015|publisher=Guardian Media Group|accessdate=21 September 2017|newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref> **17 June – BBC Two airs the first in a series of televised debates ahead of the [[Labour Party (UK) leadership election, 2015|2015 Labour Party leadership election]] which sees the potential candidates hoping to succeed Ed Miliband go head-to-head in front of a studio audience.<ref>{{cite news|last=Gilbert |first=Simon |url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/local-news/labour-leadership-debate-broadcast-live-9471868 |title=Labour leadership debate to be broadcast live from Nuneaton tonight on BBC2 |publisher=Trinity Mirror |newspaper=Coventry Telegraph |date=17 June 2015 |accessdate=17 June 2015}}</ref> **28 June – BBC Two airs the final edition of ''Top Gear'' to be presented by Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May, a 75-minute compilation of footage shot before the trio quit the show. After its broadcast Clarkson says that he is "so sad and sorry it's ended like this".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/33304225 |title=Jeremy Clarkson 'so sorry' after his last Top Gear |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=28 June 2015 |accessdate=28 June 2015}}</ref> **5 July – The [[2015 FIFA Women's World Cup Final]] between the [[United States women's national soccer team|United States]] and [[Japan women's national football team|Japan]] is aired on BBC Two.<ref>{{cite news|last=Delgado |first=Kasia |url=http://www.radiotimes.com/news/2015-07-03/bbc3-to-show-england-v-germany-womens-world-cup-play-off |title=Women's World Cup: Where can I watch England v Germany? BBC3 |publisher= |work=Radio Times |date=3 July 2015 |accessdate=6 July 2015}}</ref> The coverage is watched by an audience of 500,000.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-33422820 |title=Women's World Cup breaks TV records |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=7 July 2015 |accessdate=7 July 2015}}</ref> **4 October – The BBC admits that a volcanic eruption shown on the first episode of BBC Two's ''[[Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise]]'' was actually footage from two different volcanoes taken four years apart.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-34437703 |title=BBC 'should have told' viewers of doctored volcano video |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=4 October 2015 |accessdate=4 October 2015}}</ref> **2 November – |BBC Two debuts ''[[Simply Nigella]]'', the first cookery programme to be presented by [[Nigella Lawson]] since her personal life was the subject of a high-profile court case. The programme, aired at 8.30pm, attracts 2.3 million viewers (a 10.8% audience share), but proves to be to the detriment of the quiz show ''[[Only Connect]]'', which was moved forward an hour from its usual slot to make way for Lawson's new show. Having attracted an audience of 2.3 for its 26 October edition, ''Only Connect''{{'}}s new timeslot sees it garner a viewership of 1.7 million, a drop of 600,000. The show will return to its usual time once ''Simply Nigella'' has finished.<ref>{{cite news|first=Mark |last=Sweney |url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2015/nov/03/nigella-lawson-bbc-only-connect?CMP=ema_546 |title=Nigella Lawson's BBC return draws 2.3m viewers – but baffles Only Connect fans |publisher=Guardian Media Group |newspaper=The Guardian |date=3 November 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref> The first episode of ''Simply Nigella'' also becomes the subject of a social media storm after viewers are shown how to make avocado on toast, with many feeling the recipe is too easy.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.9news.com.au/world/2015/11/04/09/58/avocado-gate-nigella-lawson-recipe-causes-twitter-storm |title=‘Avocado-gate’: Nigella Lawson recipe causes Twitter storm |publisher=Nine Network |work=Nine News |date=4 November 2015 |accessdate=6 November 2015}}</ref>
*'''2016''' **19 January – BBC One controller [[Charlotte Moore (TV executive)|Charlotte Moore]] is appointed to the newly created role of controller of BBC TV channels and iPlayer, while [[Kim Shillinglaw]], current controller of BBC Two and BBC Four is to leave the BBC and her position abolished.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-35352511 |title=BBC One controller Charlotte Moore expands role to include iPlayer |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=19 January 2016 |accessdate=19 January 2016}}</ref> **15 February – [[BBC Two]] begins airing ''[[The People v. O. J. Simpson: American Crime Story|The People v. O. J. Simpson]]'', the first series in the American true crimes anthology, ''[[American Crime Story]]''.<ref>{{cite news|first=Ben |last=Travis |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/stayingin/tvfilm/the-people-vs-oj-simpson-bbc2-four-things-you-need-to-know-about-american-crime-story-a3180946.html |title=The People vs OJ Simpson, BBC2: four things you need to know about American Crime Story |newspaper=London Evening Standard |publisher= |date=15 February 2016 |accessdate=17 February 2018}}</ref> **29 May – ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'' relaunches with [[Chris Evans (presenter)|Chris Evans]] as presenter.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-36409943 |title=Top Gear returns to BBC Two with new hosts |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=29 May 2016 |accessdate=29 May 2016}}</ref> The episode is seen by an average 4.4 million viewers.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-36411819 |title=Top Gear return watched by 4.4m viewers |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=30 May 2016 |accessdate=30 May 2016}}</ref> **25 June – ***Following the [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|EU referendum]] in which the UK voted to leave the European Union, ''[[Newsnight]]'' airs a special edition looking at life after [[Brexit]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.radiotimes.com/tv-programme/e/d8b6fq/newsnight--life-after-brexit-a-newsnight-special/ |title=Life After Brexit: A Newsnight Special |publisher=Radio Times |date=25 June 2018 |accessdate=21 November 2018}}</ref> ***[[Adele]] headlines the Pyramid Stage at [[Glastonbury Festival 2016|Glastonbury 2016]]. The set, aired on BBC Two, is watched by a peak audience of 3.7 million, making it the most watched performance to be televised during this year's festival, and giving a single Glastonbury set the largest number of viewers since 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/glastonbury-festival/news/a799505/adeles-glastonbury-bbc-most-watched-across-the-weekend/|title=Adele's Glastonbury set broke BBC most-watched records|date=29 June 2016|publisher=}}</ref> **1 July – Patrick Holland, current head of documentaries commissioning at the BBC, is appointed to the newly created role of BBC Two channel editor.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2016/jul/01/great-british-bake-off-boss-tasked-with-reinvigorating-bbc2|title=Great British Bake Off boss tasked with reinvigorating BBC2|first1=Mark|last1=Sweney|first2=John|last2=Plunkett|newspaper=The Guardian |publisher=Guardian Media Group|date=1 July 2016|accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref> **11 August – The BBC has signed [[Gabby Logan]] to present ''[[The Premier League Show]]'', a midweek BBC Two magazine programme focusing on the [[Premier League]], beginning on 25 August. [[Gary Lineker]] will also present a slot on the show.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2016/aug/11/gabby-logan-bbc2-premier-league-gary-lineker |title=Gabby Logan to host BBC2 midweek Premier League show |publisher=Guardian Media Group |newspaper=The Guardian |date=11 August 2016 |accessdate=21 August 2016}}</ref> **6 September – BBC Two announces that it will dedicate its Saturday night scheduling to the arts from 1 October and throughout the autumn season, with programmes about literature, cinema and music.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-37287955 |title=BBC Two to dedicate Saturday nights to the arts |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=6 September 2016 |accessdate=9 July 2017}}</ref>
*'''2017''' **7 January – [[BBC Two]] airs the documentary ''David Bowie: The Last Five Years'' on the eve of what would have been the singer's 70th birthday.<ref>{{cite news|first=James |last=Hall |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/tv/2017/01/07/david-bowie-last-five-years-treat-treatise-musics-departed-genius/ |title=David Bowie: The Last Five Years was a treat and a treatise on music's departed genius – review |publisher=Telegraph Media Group |newspaper=The Telegraph |date=8 January 2017 |accessdate=8 January 2017}}</ref> **3 June – BBC Two airs ''Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution with Howard Goodall'', a documentary presented by [[Howard Goodall]] celebrating the 50th anniversary of the release of [[The Beatles]] album ''[[Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band]]''.<ref name=Pepper>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2017/jun/05/sgt-peppers-musical-revolution-howard-goodall-review-untold-treasures|title=Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution with Howard Goodall review – what I knew didn't even scratch the surface|first=Sam|last=Wollaston|date=5 June 2017|publisher=|via=www.theguardian.com}}</ref> **13 June – [[BBC Two]] airs the documentary ''Jo Cox: Death of An MP'' to coincide with the first anniversary of [[Murder of Jo Cox|her murder]].<ref>{{cite news|first=Raj |last=Bains |url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/news/west-yorkshire-news/year-on-jo-cox-death-13176049 |title=A year on, Jo Cox: Death Of An MP sheds new light on both the murdered mother-of-two and her killer |newspaper=Huddersfield Daily Examiner |publisher=Trinity Mirror |date=12 June 2017 |accessdate=16 June 2017}}</ref> **15 June – [[Antibiotics]] are voted Britain's greatest invention following a live television special, ''Britain's Greatest Invention'' on BBC Two.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.medsci.ox.ac.uk/news/antibiotics-win-greatest-british-invention-in-live-tv-broadcast |title=Antibiotics win Greatest British Invention in live TV broadcast |work=University of Oxford, Medical Sciences Division |publisher=University of Oxford |date=15 June 2017 |accessdate=17 June 2017}}</ref> **17 June – Following the [[Grenfell Tower fire]] in London, BBC Two pulls the documentary ''Venice Biennale: Sink or Swim'' as it features artist [[Khadija Saye]], who is believed to be among those to have perished in the blaze.<ref>{{cite news|first=Patrick |last=Grafton-Green |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/bbc-pulls-documentary-featuring-grenfell-tower-fire-victim-a3567346.html |title=BBC pulls documentary featuring Grenfell Tower fire victim |newspaper=London Evening Standard |publisher= |date=17 June 2017 |accessdate=17 June 2017}}</ref> The opening edition of BBC One's singing contest ''[[Pitch Battle]]'' is also replaced by a different edition after the blaze, a decision taken due to song lyrics.<ref name=Ratings>{{cite news|first=Emma |last=Saunders |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-40325606 |title=Hot weather hits Saturday night TV ratings |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=19 June 2017 |accessdate=19 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Sarah |last=Doran |url=http://www.radiotimes.com/news/2017-06-17/bbc-reschedules-first-episode-of-new-series-pitch-battle-following-london-fire-tragedy |title=London fire: BBC reschedule new series of Pitch Battle following Grenfell Tower tragedy |publisher=Radio Times |date=17 June 2017 |accessdate=19 June 2017}}</ref> **9 August – The BBC announces that the [[BBC Radio 4|Radio 4]] cultural review programme ''[[Front Row (radio)|Front Row]]'' will be extended to television, and begin airing on BBC Two in September.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/latestnews/2017/front-row-bbc-two|title=BBC – Front Row comes to BBC Two – Media Centre|website=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref> **18 August – BBC Two have acquired the broadcast rights to ''[[The Assassination of Gianni Versace: American Crime Story|The Assassination of Gianni Versace]]'', the second series of the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] true crimes anthology drama series ''[[American Crime Story]]''; the series will air in 2018.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/latestnews/2017/american-crime-story-2 |title=Two to air second series of American Crime Story in 2018 |work=BBC Media Centre |publisher=BBC |date=18 August 2017 |accessdate=17 February 2018}}</ref> **4 September – BBC Two airs ''[[Diana and I]]'', a film that explores how the [[death of Diana, Princess of Wales]] affected ordinary people.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-41003091|title=Diana TV drama looks at the princess's people|first=Neil|last=Smith|date=29 August 2017|publisher=BBC|accessdate=29 August 2017|work=BBC News}}</ref> **23 September – BBC Two airs the ''[[Later...with Jools Holland]]'' 25th anniversary special, a concert held at the [[Royal Albert Hall]] on 21 September. Acts include [[Foo Fighters]], [[Paul Weller]], [[Van Morrison]], [[Dizzee Rascal]], [[Gregory Porter]], [[Kali Uchis]], [[Camille (singer)|Camille]], [[Songhoy Blues]], and [[Jorja Smith]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atvtoday.co.uk/105449-bbc/|title=Later with Jools Holland reveals 25th anniversary special line up|date=7 September 2017|publisher=}}</ref> The TV version of ''[[Front Row (radio)|Front Row]]'' makes its debut on the same evening.<ref>{{cite news|first=Julie |last=McDowall |url=http://www.thenational.scot/culture/15553526.Weekend_TV_Preview__Front_Row__Strictly_Come_Dancing__The_Child_In_Time__and_Electric_Dreams/ |title=Weekend TV Preview: Front Row, Strictly Come Dancing, The Child In Time, and Electric Dreams |publisher=Herald and Times Group |newspaper=The National |date=23 September 2017 |accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> **26 September – BBC Two airs the ''[[Horizon (UK TV series)|Horizon]]'' documentary "Being Transgender", a film that looks at what it means to be [[transgender]], and what happens when someone undergoes [[transitioning (transgender)|transitioning]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radiotimes.com/tv-programme/e/fwxwrs/horizon--s2017-e15-horizon-being-transgender/|title=Horizon: Being Transgender – S2017|website=Radio Times}}</ref> **30 September – Launch of ''[[Saturday Mash-Up!]]'' on BBC Two and CBBC, a new Saturday morning children's TV show that will attempt to recapture the spirit of classic BBC programmes such as ''[[Going Live!]]'' and ''[[Live & Kicking]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-41433101|title=Let the gunge flow! Saturday morning kids' TV goes live again|first=Ian|last=Youngs|date=29 September 2017|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
*'''2018''' **17 March – BBC Two announces it will axe ''[[Robot Wars (TV series)|Robot Wars]]'' for the second time due to a lack of making new action toys until [[Hexbug]] reintroduced production rather late, the series having been revived in 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/newsbeat-43442628 |title=Robot Wars has been axed by the BBC again |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=17 March 2018 |accessdate=18 March 2018}}</ref> **28 May – BBC Two airs a [[King Lear (2018 film)|new adaptation]] of ''[[King Lear]]'' set in a fictionalised present, and starring [[Anthony Hopkins]] in the eponymous role, as well as [[Emma Thompson]], [[Emily Watson]] and [[Florence Pugh]] as Lear's daughters.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/proginfo/2018/22/king-lear |title=King Lear |work=BBC Media Centre |publisher=BBC |date= |accessdate=2 September 2018}}</ref> **14 August – BBC Two airs one-off edition of the 1990s comedy sketch show ''[[Goodness Gracious Me (TV series)|Goodness Gracious Me]]'' featuring new material, and old and new characters.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.asianimage.co.uk/news/16418593.tv-goodness-gracious-me-reunion-special/ |title=TV Goodness Gracious Me: Reunion Special |publisher=Asian Image |date=14 August 2018 |accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> **28 August – BBC Two confirms that ''[[Springwatch|Autumnwatch]]'' will air a week of programmes from [[New England]] in October to celebrate the [[Autumn in New England|US region's colourful autumn]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-45332214 |title=Autumnwatch heads for leafy New England |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=28 August 2018 |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref> **25 September – BBC Two airs ''The Flu That Killed 50 Million'', a docudrama about the [[Spanish flu|1918 flu pandemic]] narrated by [[Christopher Eccleston]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2018/sep/25/tuesday-best-tv-flu-that-killed-50m |title=Tuesday’s best TV: The Flu That Killed 50 Million |publisher=Guardian Media Group |newspaper=The Guardian |date=25 September 2018 |accessdate=25 September 2018}}</ref> **27 September – BBC Two receives a new set of idents. The [[BBC Two 'Curve' idents|Curve idents]] replace the '2' logo in various ident sets since 1991.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-45666478 |title=BBC Two gets a playful new look |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=27 September 2018 |accessdate=30 September 2018}}</ref> **28 October – BBC Two airs a [[Dead Line (Inside No. 9)|live episode]] of the anthology series ''[[Inside No. 9]]'' to coincide with [[Halloween]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Peters |first=Sam |url=https://www.radiotimes.com/news/tv/2018-10-28/inside-no-9-live-halloween-episode-how-it-works/ |title=How will Inside No 9’s live Halloween episode work – and what happens if they forget their lines? |publisher=Radio Times |date=28 October 2018 |accessdate=28 October 2018}}</ref> **20 November – The BBC Two programmes ''[[Winterwatch]]'', ''[[Springwatch]]'' and ''[[Autumnwatch]]'' will be broadcast from the [[Cairngorms]] in 2019.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-highlands-islands-46277408 |title=Winterwatch, Springwatch and Autumnwatch to be in Cairngorms |work=BBC News |publisher=BBC |date=20 November 2018 |accessdate=20 November 2018}}</ref>

{{close paraphrasing|date=February 2016}} {{Infobox person | name = Tom Mullica | image = File:Tom Mullica cigarette trick.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Thomas Blaine Mullica | birth_date = {{Birth date|1948|8|19}} | birth_place = [[Waupun, Wisconsin]], US | years_active = 1970–2016 | known_for = Television & stage appearances as a magician and comedian. | occupation = [[Actor]], [[Magic (illusion)|Magician]], [[Comedian]], [[Clown]], [[Ventriloquist]], [[Mime artist|Pantomimist]]. | death_date = {{Death date and age|2016|02|18|1948|8|19|mf=y}} | death_place = [[Las Vegas, Nevada]], US | death_cause = [[Multiple organ dysfunction syndrome]] | nationality = American | notable works = | misc = | website = {{URL|http://www.tommullica.com/}} }} '''Thomas Blaine Mullica''' (August 19, 1948 – February 18, 2016), was an American comedy [[Magic (illusion)|magician]] and [[Impressionist (entertainment)|impressionist]] who performed on television specials, and appeared on TV many times including ''[[Late Night with David Letterman]]'', ''[[The World's Greatest Magic]]'', ''[[Viva Variety]]'' and ''[[Penn & Teller's Sin City Spectacular|Penn & Teller's Sin City]]''.
One of Mullica's most memorable appearances was on [[Late Night with David Letterman]],<ref>{{YouTube|uOJ6T2d6mAI|Comic Magician Tom Mullica On Late Nite Talk Show}}</ref> on which he performed his popular signature effect of the manipulation and vanishing of several cigarettes in his mouth.
In 1984 Mullica was awarded $5,000 cash for winning the Siegfried & Roy Golden Lion Award at the Magic Desert Seminar in Las Vegas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tommullica.com/|title=Home|work=tommullica.com}}</ref>
He also performed at the [[Just for Laughs| Just for Laughs Comedy Festival]] and toured the US and Canada with RED – A Performance Tribute, a [[Red Skelton]] Tribute show which Mullica wrote and starred in as Skelton and his characters. RED is the only Skelton tribute show authorized by the Skelton Estate.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skeltontribute.com/mullica.htm|title=TOM MULLICA|work=skeltontribute.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120420205129/http://www.skeltontribute.com/mullica.htm|archivedate=2012-04-20|df=}}</ref>
In July 2013 Mullica helped dedicate the Red Skelton Museum & Education Center.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hamnerbarber.com/2013/07/16/tom-mullica-celebrates-100-years-of-red-skelton/|title=Tom Mullica Celebrates 100 Years Of Red Skelton|date=4 October 2012|work=Hamner Barber Theater}}</ref>
==Personal life== He was born Thomas Blaine Mullica in [[Waupun, Wisconsin]] on August 19, 1948. When Mullica was five years old, he wanted to be a clown. However, on his seventh birthday his mother bought him a "Sneaky Pete Magic Kit" for Christmas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.all-about-magicians.com/tom-mullica.html|title=Tom Mullica - Biography - All About Magicians.Com|work=All About Magicians}}</ref>
After he graduated from Waupun High School in 1966, he enlisted in the Army at age 18, serving 3 years in Korea and Germany. Once he had finished his military service he moved to Colon, Michigan, where he built illusions and demonstrated magic for Abbott's Magic Company.
Mullica then moved to [[Atlanta, Georgia]] where he attended bartending school and opened his own nightclub called The Tom-foolery Magic Bar Theater which was open from 1976 until 1987.
Red Skelton visited the Tom-foolery in 1980 and they became fast friends. After the closure of Tom-foolery Mullica asked Skelton for his advice, and Skelton suggested that he take his best material and perform it pantomime to music, which would eliminate any language barrier so that he could perform anywhere in the world. Mullica took Skelton's advice and after six months of rehearsal moved to Paris, France where he worked at the [[Crazy Horse Saloon]].
Mullica returned to the United States in 1991 and continued his comedy magic career. In 1996, he began writing RED (A Performance Tribute) which he performed in theaters throughout America and Canada.
In 2010, Mullica was diagnosed with [[Acute myeloid leukemia|acute myelogenous leukemia]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.magician.org/blog/tom-mullica-giving-up-red--returning-to-magic?blogid=176|title=Tom Mullica Giving up Red; Returning to Magic - The International Brotherhood of Magicians|website=www.magician.org|access-date=2018-07-16}}</ref>
==Death==
On February 15, 2016, Mullica was placed in an induced coma following complications stemming from a routine hernia operation, which caused him to have several strokes. He subsequently suffered from organ and liver failure. On February 18, it was decided to take Mullica off life support.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.magic-compass.com/r-i-p-tom-mullica-1948-2016/|title=R.I.P. Tom Mullica 1948 – 2016|work=The Magic Compass}}</ref> He was 67.

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2016}} {{Infobox person |name = Trudi Roth |image = Trudi Roth spielt Tante Martha for EN-WP.jpg |image_caption = Trudi Roth as [[Martha Aebersold|Tante Martha]] in ''[[Fascht e Familie]]'' (late 1990s) |birth_date = {{birth date|1930|4|2|df=yes}} |birth_place = [[Basel]], [[Switzerland]] |death_date = {{Death date and age|2016|06|11|1930|4|2|df=yes}} |death_place = Zürich, Switzerland |occupation = Stage and film actress |years_active = 1947–2016 |residence = [[Wetzikon]] |notable_works = ''[[Fascht e Familie]]'' (1994–1999)
''[[Lüthi und Blanc]]'' (2000–2002) }} '''Trudi Roth''' (2 April 1930 – 11 June 2016) was a Swiss stage and film actress who starred in Swiss German language cinema and television and stage productions. == Biography == Born in [[Basel, Switzerland]], Roth lived in the [[Municipalities in the canton of Zürich|municipality of Zürich]]. Her first stage experiences date back to her childhood as she had a small role at the ''Stadttheater'' Basel in 1939. She attended the ''Konservatorium'' under Ernst Ginsberg in Basel, followed by performances beginning in 1947 with the ''cabaret-doodle-doo'', ''KiKeriKi'' with [[César Keiser]] and [[Cabaret Cornichon]] respectively ''Cabaret Fédéral''. Later she starred in comedies and musicals, and Trudi Roth acted for the radio in radio plays and for the Swiss television. Roth's most popular role was the character of [[Fascht e Familie#Martha Aebersold (Trudi Roth)|''Martha Aebersold'']] in the Swiss comedy serial ''[[Fascht e Familie]]'' in the 1990s.{{cite web|url=http://www.srf.ch/sendungen/fascht-e-familie/tante-martha|title=Tante Martha|accessdate=7 April 2015|language=German|work=SRF}} Among others, Trudi Ruth also starred in about a dozen plays, musicals and farces on [[Bernhard-Theater Zürich]] between 1965 and 2001.{{cite web|url=http://tls.theaterwissenschaft.ch/wiki/Trudi_Roth|title=Trudi Roth|publisher=theaterwissenschaft.ch|author=Mats Staub|language=German|accessdate=15 June 2016}} Trudi Roth motivated film director Marie-Louise Bless to create the television film ''[[Das Paar im Kahn]]'' in 2004.{{cite web|url=http://www.srf.ch/medien/wp-content/uploads/chronik/upload/Medienmappe-_Das-Paar-im-Kahn__1.pdf.|title=Medienmappe Das Paar im Kahn|publisher=Schweizer Fernsehen SF|author=|language=German|accessdate=15 June 2016}} [[Charles Lewinsky]], creator of ''[[Fascht e Familie]]'', recalls that ''she played every summer the [[Chaschperli]] in Zürich, followed by appearances in films, television series and in the [[Bernhard Theater]]. At the age of 80, she still played a role in his play 'Huusfründe'.''{{cite web|url=http://www.limmattalerzeitung.ch/panorama/people/tante-martha-schweigt-fuer-immer-schauspielerin-trudi-roth-mit-86-jahren-gestorben-130349122|title=Tante Martha schweigt für immer: Schauspielerin Trudi Roth mit 86 Jahren gestorben|publisher=[[Limmattaler Zeitung]], in: ''Nordwestschweiz''|author=Dominique Waldmann|language=German|date=2016-06-14|accessdate=2016-06-16}} He remembers the long conversations with Trudi Roth: ''It was impossible, to talk briefly with Trudi. When I told my wife, now I call on Trudi she said: 'I'll see you in an hour'.'' Trudi Roth was Charles Lewinsky sympathetic at the first co-operation, above all ''to have the gift of the gab''.{{cite web|url=http://www.srf.ch/play/tv/glanz-amp-gloria/video/glanz--gloria-nimmt-abschied-von-tante-martha-trudi-roth?id=596f7fa3-acb3-4d45-8b21-2218fff67c7e|title="Glanz & Gloria" nimmt Abschied von "Tante Martha" Trudi Roth|publisher=Schweizer Fernsehen SF|language=German|date=12 June 2016|accessdate=15 June 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://m.srf.ch/sendungen/glanz-und-gloria/wegbegleiter-von-trudi-roth-erinnern-sich-an-die-schauspielerin|title=Wegbegleiter von Trudi Roth erinnern sich an die Schauspielerin|publisher=Schweizer Fernsehen SF|author1=Sandro Sabatini|author2=Michael Gerber|language=German|date=14 June 2016|accessdate=16 June 2016}} == Personal life == From 1953 to 1957 she lived in Düsseldorf while working for the German ''Kom(m)ödchen'' ensemble; Roth then returned to Basel. With her partner Hans Moeckel, conductor of the Swiss Federal entertainment orchestra, she moved to Zürich in the 1970s. Although in a relationship, she remained single and childless. == Death == In the last years of her life, the actress sometimes did not recognize her brother Alfred, and forgot her former success as an artist. We were very close, "like twins," he said in an interview: ''She had a quirky sense of humor, was never jealous, spoke directly and lived modestly''." As Trudi Roth's family announced to the Swiss television SRF, the actress and cabaret artist died on the night of 11 June 2016 in a nursing home in Zürich. Cause of death was her age of 86, and dementia. == Awards == * 1995: ''[[Prix Walo]]'' == Filmography (selected works) == * 2004: ''Flamingo'' (TV series) * 1994–1997: ''[[Fascht e Familie]]'' (100 episodes) * 1980: ''Theo Against the Rest of the World'' * 1962: ''The 42th Heaven'' * 1953: ''Metamorphose'' == References == {{reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{IMDb name|id=0745041|name=Trudi Roth}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Roth, Trudi}} [[Category:1930 births]] [[Category:2016 deaths]] [[Category:Swiss stage actresses]] [[Category:Swiss film actresses]] [[Category:20th-century Swiss actresses]] [[Category:People from Basel-Stadt]] [[Category:Swiss musical theatre actresses]] [[Category:Swiss television actresses]] [[Category:Swiss satirists]] [[Category:Parodists]] [[Category:Disease-related deaths in Switzerland]]

{{refimprove|date=June 2013}}
'''"Voices from the Other World"''' is a celebrated early [[poem]] by [[James Merrill]] (1926-1995). it marks the poet's first use of transcripts from a [[ouija board]], a trope later explored at great length in the poet's [[apocalypse|apocalyptic]] [[epic poem|epic]] "[[The Changing Light at Sandover]]" (1982).
[[File:JamesMerrillDavidJackson1973window.jpg|thumb|right|200px|[[James Merrill]] and [[David Noyes Jackson|David Jackson]] at home in [[Athens, Greece]], 14 October 1973. With the help of [[psychic|psychic readings]] transcribed by the couple from a home-made [[ouija board]], Merrill would compose "Voices from the Other World", the first of many poems to explore the ouija board conceit. (Photograph by Judith Moffett)]] The poem, written in the [[First-person narrative|first person]] plural, consists of nine irregularly-rhymed five-line stanzas. The (unnamed) narrators of the poem are Merrill and his partner [[David Noyes Jackson|David Jackson]], who together — after a Ouija board had been given to Merrill as a present by his friend [[Frederick Buechner]] in the early 1950s — would conduct hundreds of private [[séance]] sessions over the course of nearly four decades, an undertaking Merrill would come to mine extensively for "material." In this early [[Spirit|spiritual]] encounter, the ouija board voices warn Merrill and Jackson of the perils of speaking with the dead, though by poem's end the two mediums have been lulled into a sense of nonchalance about the enterprise.
"Voices from the Other World" was first published in book form in ''The Country of a Thousand Years of Peace'' (1959).
== External links == * [http://www.poetryfoundation.org/poem/179112 "Voices from the Other World"], text of the poem (The Poetry Foundation)
[[Category:American poems]] [[Category:Narrative poems]] [[Category:Poetry by James Merrill]]

'''Yasmeen Godder''' ({{lang-he|יסמין גודר}}), born in 1973, is an [[Israelis|Israeli]] [[choreographer]] and dancer.
==Biography== Yasmeen was born and raised until the age of 14 in [[Jerusalem]], [[Israel]]. As a child, she danced at Professor Hasia Levi-Agron's class, and [[ballet]] at Yaakov Lipshitz's in Jerusalem. Her first performance was an end-of-year dance at [[Jerusalem International YMCA|YMCA Jerusalem]], when she was 6 years old. In 1984, at the age of 11, Yasmeen and her family moved to [[New York City]]. She graduated from the [[High School of the Performing Arts]] there, and received a scholarship at the [[Martha Graham School]] in New York City, where she would dance every Saturday when she was 14 to 17. Her first creation was heavily inspired off of Admon Zabes' letters. Upon finishing her studies, she returned to Israel, though returned to the [[United States]] for her academic studies, and received her BA in concert dance from the ]]Tisch School of the Arts]] at [[New York University]] in 1997, where she presented her works for the first time, and at the same time studied in other institutions outside Tisch as well, among them Movement Center, where many concert dance teachers and artists with diverse opinions gather and discuss controversial concert dance issues.
Yasmeen finished her academic studies in 1997, and since then has been presenting her works in various places. The first place where she danced and presented her works was at [[Gowanus, Brooklyn|Gowanus]] Arts Exchange. Following, she was invited to present her works at Duncan Center in [[Prague]], [[Czech Republic]]. During her final year at Tisch, she worked on her piece ''A Car and a Bandage''. Then, she created two new pieces, the solo pieces ''Ina's Wall'' and ''Ring Ding Round Zero''.
Since 1999, she has been living in [[Tel Aviv]]. Her works have regularly been presented at the [[Suzanne Dellal Center]] in Tel Aviv, and extensively throughout the world, for example at [[Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts|Lincoln Center]] Festival in New York, [[Hebbel am Ufer]] in [[Berlin]], the [[Place Theatre]] in [[London]], Montpellier Dance Festival in [[France]], and many more. To date, Yasmeen has created a total of 8 long works (over 1 hour long) and 6 short ones (up to 45 minutes long), including "Green Fields" for the Batsheva Ensemble and "UNDER2", a Matanicola Production in Berlin. The company had recently won the Ministry of Culture's Prize for Small Ensemble for the performance of Singular Sensation. In 2014, Godder created her first site-specific choreography for the Petach Tikva Museum of Art, Israel as part of the exhibition 'Set in Motion' (co-curated by Drorit Gur Arie, and Avi Feldman). Following the exhibition, the first artist book dedicated to the work of Godder was published under the title: 'Extremum - Reflections on the Works of Yasmeen Godder'.
Yasmeen is the artistic director of her dance company, where she teaches concert dance since her return to Israel. She has taught concert dance in several art schools in Israel, among them the [[Jerusalem Academy of Music and Dance]] and Bikurei HaItim in Tel Aviv. In 2007, she established the Yasmeen Godder Studio at the Mendel Culture Center in [[Jaffa]], and to this day all of her activity is based there, as well as it being where the company's offices are situated, where the company mainly rehearses, and where she mainly teaches nowadays.
==Awards==
{{div col}} *2009 – Rozenblum Prize for the Performing Arts, on behalf of Tel Aviv Municipality. *2006 – [[Mifal Hapayis]] Landau Prize for the Performing Arts *2004 – Rozenblum Prize for the Performing Arts, on behalf of Tel Aviv Municipality. *2003 – Ministry of Culture Young Choreographers' Prize *2002 – Israel Cultural Excellence Foundation Nomination *2001 – Ministry of Culture Young Choreographers' Prize *2000 – Choreography Grant of the [[New York Foundation for the Arts]] *1999 – Choreography Contest for Hasia Levi-Agron (on behalf of the Jerusalem Academy of Music and Dance) in Jerusalem Prize for Yasmeen's works ''Ilana's Wall'' and ''Say Goodbye Nicely'' {{div col end}}
==Further reading==
Avi Feldman (editor). ''Extremum - Reflections on the Works of Yasmeen Godder''. Asia Publishers and Petach Tikva Museum of Art 2014.

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2016}} {{Infobox video game | title = Zeno Clash | image = ZenoClash cover.png | caption = North American Microsoft Windows cover | developer = [[ACE Team]] | publisher = {{Unbulleted list|'''Microsoft Windows'''|{{Video game release|WW|ACE Team {{small|(digital)}}|EU|[[Iceberg Interactive]]|NA|[[Tripwire Interactive]]}}|'''Xbox 360'''|[[Atlus]]}} | engine = [[Source (game engine)|Source]] | released = '''Microsoft Windows'''{{Video game release|WW|21 April 2009 {{small|(digital)}}|EU|9 October 2009|NA|22 February 2010}}'''Xbox 360'''{{Video game release|NA|5 May 2010}} | genre = [[Beat 'em up]], [[first-person shooter]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] | platforms = {{Unbulleted list|[[Microsoft Windows]]|[[Xbox 360]]}} }} '''''Zeno Clash''''' is a [[First-person (video games)|first-person]] [[fighting game|fighting]] [[video game]] with elements of a [[first-person shooter]]. It is the debut game of developer [[ACE Team]] and uses the [[Source (game engine)|Source engine]]. It was released for download through content delivery service [[Steam (software)|Steam]] on 21 April, {{vgy|2009}}. The Xbox 360 version, entitled ''Zeno Clash: Ultimate Edition'', was released 5 May 2010 and contains additional features not found in the PC version. The game is set in the fantasy world of Zenozoik, and follows Ghat, a young man who is on the run from his vengeful siblings, and Deadra, his female companion, as they travel through strange and exotic lands. The PC version of the game was favorably received and received an aggregate score of 77/100 on [[Metacritic]] and 77.50% on [[GameRankings]]. The Xbox 360 version was also praised and gained an average 74/100 at Metacritic and 75.46% at GameRankings. Critics praised its strange yet robust setting and unique character designs. It was a finalist for Excellence in Visual Art at the 2009 [[Independent Games Festival]], was named 2009's Independent Game of the Year by ''[[PC Gamer]]'', and PC Game of the Month by [[IGN]] in April 2009. == Gameplay == [[File:Zeno Clash - Fight.jpg|thumb|left|alt=A screenshot of the game in first-person perspective. The player is engaged in battle with several enemies in a forest.|''Zeno Clash'' places a heavy emphasis on first-person combat.]] In the main story mode, players assume the role of Ghat and progress through the world of Zenozoik, visiting various locations in a linear sequence. Gameplay is presented in [[First person (video games)|first-person perspective]], with occasional [[cutscene]]s in [[Third-person (video games)|third-person perspective]]. When the player enters certain areas, it triggers a [[scripted sequence]], initiating a battle in which the player must defeat all enemies to proceed. Ghat is proficient in martial arts, and can dodge or counter enemy attacks. While there is a strong focus on unarmed combat, Ghat can also obtain unconventional melee and ranged weapons by several means, such as disarming enemies. Intermittent segments of the game play similarly to a linear progression shooter.{{cite web | title=World Exclusive: The Zeno Clash Review | url=http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2009/04/19/world-exclusive-the-zeno-clash-review/ | first=Gillen | last=Kieron |author2=Meer, Alec |author3=Rossignol, Jim |author4= Walker, John | publisher=[[Rock, Paper, Shotgun]] | date=19 April 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}}{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash | url=http://pc.ign.com/objects/959/959787.html | author=Staff | publisher=[[IGN]] | accessdate=5 November 2009}} In addition to the single-player story, Challenge Mode allows the player to defeat enemies while climbing a tower or descending into a pit. The results are ranked through [[Steam (software)|Steam]] every time the player beats a tower floor's final [[boss (video gaming)|boss]].{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash's Survival Mode | url=http://blogs.aceteam.cl/zenoclash/index.php?showentry=18 | last=Bordeu | first=Andre | publisher=[[ACE Team]] | date=25 February 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} {{clear left}} == Plot == [[File:Zeno Clash - Father-Mother.jpg|thumb|Father-Mother]] The story takes place in a fictional fantasy world called Zenozoik, and begins in a town called Halstedom. The game commences with Ghat, the game's protagonist, regaining consciousness after setting off an explosion which kills Father-Mother, an ostensibly [[hermaphrodite|hermaphroditic]] creature, which has raised a large and influential family. Ghat is one of Father-Mother's children, who turned on it after discovering its secret.{{cite video game | title=Zeno Clash | developer=ACE Team | date=21 April 2009 | level=Return | quote='''Golem''': It is by chance and not virtue, that Ghat discovered a flaw in Father-Mother. After that both Ghat's an Father-Mother's reaction was irrational and violent.}} Ghat runs away from the town,{{cite video game | title=Zeno Clash | developer=ACE Team | date=21 April 2009 | level=Return | quote='''Golem''': After Ghat fought Father-Mother he ran away.}} chased by his brothers and sisters seeking to kill him, and is banished from his family. He is accompanied by a female companion named Deadra who has saved Ghat from apathy.{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash. Interview with Carlos Bordeu | url=http://playhard.ru/Article.aspx?id=3218 | author=Unicorn | publisher=PlayHard | date=23 April 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}}{{cite video game | title=Zeno Clash | developer=ACE Team | date=21 April 2009 | level=Return | quote='''Golem''': And you, Deadra, were most kind, saving him from apathy and searching for safety with him.}} During their travels away from Halstedom, Ghat explains to Deadra through partially interactive flashbacks the events that led up to his attempt on Father-Mother's life. One of the first things that is mentioned is that he lived for a time with the Corwid of the Free, the insane residents of the forests of Zenozoik.{{cite web | title=New Zeno Clash trailer | url=http://blogs.aceteam.cl/zenoclash/index.php?showentry=25 | last=C | first=David | publisher=ACE Team | date=9 April 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} While he has turned away from his past life as a Corwid, his brothers and sisters still consider him as one. Ghat still harbors a sense of admiration for the single-mindedness of Corwids. Regardless, when he encounters them a fight ensues.{{cite video game | title=Zeno Clash | developer=ACE Team | date=21 April 2009 | level=The Corwid of the Free}} Later on, Deadra and Ghat reach a large desert area. When Ghat returns from hunting rabbit-like creatures, he discovers a blind mercenary known only as the Hunter, who points a rifle at Deadra's head while she sleeps. The Hunter reveals that he was sent after them by Ghat's family, and was instructed to kill both him and Deadra. Ghat pleads for her life, and the Hunter agrees to let her live if Ghat will come to a secluded area with him to fight. Ghat manages to defeat the Hunter and then leaves with Deadra.{{cite video game | title=Zeno Clash | developer=ACE Team | date=21 April 2009 | level=Hunter Hunter}} Ghat and Deadra eventually reach the end of the world. It is there that they meet Golem, an ancient being placed there by an unknown group of people to wait there until he was needed.{{cite video game | title=Zeno Clash | developer=ACE Team | date=21 April 2009 | level=Return | quote='''Golem''': I had a duty to stay there. To watch, to wait. Long before you were born, I was there. .. The people who put me there were wise.}} Golem has a complete knowledge of Ghat and Father-Mother's conflict, which he says he will end, along with all other conflicts.{{cite video game | title=Zeno Clash | developer=ACE Team | date=21 April 2009 | level=Throne}} Upon Ghat's return to the city, he is confronted by his angry brothers and sisters once more. After this confrontation, a heavily wounded Father-Mother reveals itself, showing that it is still alive. It declares another fight with Ghat to end the strife once and for all. A ferocious battle ensues, in which Ghat defeats Father-Mother once more. With Father-Mother at his mercy, he decides neither to kill it, nor reveal its secret. However, Golem discloses the secret anyway—that Father-Mother is actually a male creature that steals babies from their families. It is revealed that Ghat, upon inadvertently learning this, was chased out of town by Father-Mother in an attempt to protect his secret. The game ends after Golem makes several cryptic statements about their world and family.{{cite video game | title=Zeno Clash | developer=ACE Team | date=21 April 2009 | level=Family Reunion}} == Development == [[File:Zeno Clash - Vs.jpg|thumb|alt=A screenshot of the game, just before a fight commences. Portraits of the characters involved in the battle are shown on opposing sides of the screen.|''Zeno Clash'' uses slide-in versus screens before combat akin to many fighting games.]] While ''Zeno Clash'' was ACE Team's first original game, they have been developing game [[Mod (computer gaming)|modifications]] since the 1990s.{{cite web | title=Old ACE Team Games | url=http://blogs.aceteam.cl/zenoclash/index.php?showentry=30 | last=Bordeu | first=Edmundo | publisher=ACE Team | date=30 April 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} Their last project, ''Zenozoik'', was far larger in scope than ''Zeno Clash'', and attempted to incorporate the disparate elements of shooting, [[role-playing games|role-playing]], melee combat and [[sandbox game]]play. ACE Team later realized that it was too ambitious for a small independent studio, and decided to make a more focused game. ''Zeno Clash'' is what emerged—player exploration is linear, and role-playing elements were excluded altogether. The game was initially conceived as a total conversion modification using the [[Source engine]]. ACE Team showed a demo version to Valve, the creators of the engine, who were impressed by the game's quality. The two companies then negotiated an engine licensing and distribution deal.{{cite web | title=Unknown Pleasures 2009: Zeno Clash | url=http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2009/01/30/unknown-pleasures-2009-zeno-clash/ | last=Walker | first=John | publisher=Rock, Paper, Shotgun | date=30 January 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} In an interview, the developers have stated that they consider the game to be a "First-Person Fighter (with some shooter elements)". They also likened it to "[[Dark Messiah of Might and Magic|Dark Messiah]] meets [[Double Dragon]]", and stated that they have drawn a lot of inspiration from traditional fighting games—this includes "versus screens" sliding in before combat is initiated.{{cite web | title=ACE Team – Game development at World's end | url=http://www.zillionmonkey.com/?page_id=209 | publisher=ZillionMonkey | accessdate=5 November 2009}} Regarding the art style, they cited [[Hieronymus Bosch]]'s paintings and [[John Blanche]]'s "punk fantasy" illustrations as visual inspirations. They stated that publishers were unsure if consumers could relate to the art direction, but nonetheless stuck to their vision, creating a game that looks unlike anything else on the market.{{cite web | title= Postmortem: ACE Team's ''Zeno Clash'' | url=http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/4156/postmortem_ace_teams_zeno_clash.php | last=Bordeu | first=Carlos | publisher=[[Gamasutra]] | date=8 October 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} To get their desired organic look, they used static props exported from [[3D Studio Max]] with pre-rendered lighting instead of using brush-based geometry that Source was specialized for. On October 2009, ACE Team announced that they partnered with [[Atlus]] to release a port of the game for [[Xbox Live Arcade]].{{Cite web |accessdate=14 December 2010 |publisher=ACE Team |url=http://forums.aceteam.cl/index.php?s=1a5d1dcf4f9954fd980b21008bcc295e&autocom=blog&blogid=2&showentry=38 |title=Zeno Clash: Ultimate Edition for XBLA announced |date=1 October 2009 |first=Carlos |last=Bordeu}} This version of the game dubbed ''Zeno Clash: Ultimate Edition'' adds new game modes and features such as [[cooperative gameplay]] for tower challenges in both offline and online games, new attacks, new weapons, a new voice actress for the character Deadra,{{Cite web |accessdate=14 December 2010 |publisher=ACE Team |url=http://forums.aceteam.cl/index.php?s=&showtopic=1159&view=findpost&p=8693 |title=New voice acting for Deadra? |date=10 March 2010 |first=Carlos |last=Bordeu |quote=Yes, correct. Deadra's voice was completely re-recorded. She has a new voice and sounds a lot better now.}} a character gallery and an awareness system.{{Cite web |accessdate=14 December 2010 |publisher=ACE Team |url=http://forums.aceteam.cl/index.php?s=1a5d1dcf4f9954fd980b21008bcc295e&autocom=blog&blogid=2&showentry=43 |title=New full Trailer - GDC Awards tomorrow |date=10 March 2010 |first=Carlos |last=Bordeu}}{{Cite web |accessdate=14 December 2010 |publisher=ACE Team |url=http://forums.aceteam.cl/index.php?s=1a5d1dcf4f9954fd980b21008bcc295e&autocom=blog&blogid=2&showentry=44 |title=Zeno Clash: UE, finally out on May 5th |date=28 April 2010 |first=Carlos |last=Bordeu}} ''Zeno Clash: Ultimate Edition'' was released on Xbox Live Arcade on 5 May 2010.{{Cite web |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2010/04/29/zeno-clash-assaults-xbox-live-arcade-may-5-new-trailer-now/ |title=Zeno Clash assaults XBLA on May 5; new trailer now |first=David |last=Hinkle |date=29 April 2010 |accessdate=14 December 2010 |publisher=[[Joystiq]]}} In July 2009 [[source code]] of the game to allow easier modding was released by the developer.[http://www.thatvideogameblog.com/2009/07/29/zeno-clash-devs-release-source-code-to-all/ Zenoclash devs release source code] (2009) {{clear}} == Marketing and release == The game was first released for download through Valve's content delivery service, [[Steam (software)|Steam]], on 21 April 2009, and is available for purchase either directly through Steam or via Direct2Drive. It was published for retail by Noviy Disk in Russia,{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash | url=http://www.giantbomb.com/zeno-clash/61-22011/ | publisher=[[Giant Bomb]] | accessdate=5 November 2009}} and by Iceberg Interactive in Europe.{{cite web | title=Iceberg Interactive announces 2009 UK Q4 Line-Up | url=http://www.iceberg-interactive.com/index.php/news-mainmenu-33/1-latest/104-iceberg-interactive-announces-2009-uk-q4-line-up | publisher=Iceberg Interactive | date=10 September 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} In October 2009, [[Tripwire Interactive]] announced that it planned to publish the game for retail in [[North America]] "soon".{{cite web | title=Tripwire Brings Zeno Clash To Retail | url=http://kotaku.com/5374615/tripwire-brings-zeno-clash-to-retail | last=Fahey | first=Mike | publisher=[[Kotaku]] | date=5 October 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} [[Atlus]] has announced that they will be bringing an Ultimate Edition of the game to the [[Xbox 360]] as an [[Xbox Live Arcade]] download in March 2010.{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash: Ultimate Edition Coming to Xbox Live | url=http://kotaku.com/5371627/zeno-clash-ultimate-edition-coming-to-xbox-live | last=Good | first=Owen | publisher=Kotaku | date=30 September 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} ACE Team continued to provide support post-release, releasing character models for use with another Source engine game, [[Garry's Mod]],{{cite web | title=The Zeno-Garry Collective | url=http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2009/05/12/the-zeno-garry-collective/ | last=Meer | first=Alec | publisher=Rock, Paper, Shotgun | date=12 May 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} several new Challenge levels as free [[downloadable content]],{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash Gets New DLC, Goes On Sale To Celebrate | url=http://kotaku.com/5302313/zeno-clash-gets-new-dlc-goes-on-sale-to-celebrate | last=Plunkett | first=Luke | publisher=Kotaku | date=24 June 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} and a [[software development kit]].{{cite web | title=Punch! Biff! Zeno Clash SDK Released | url=http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2009/07/29/punch-biff-zeno-clash-sdk-released/ | last=Walker | first=John | publisher=Rock, Paper, Shotgun | date=29 June 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} ''Zeno Clash'' received some press for its developers' reaction to [[copyright infringement]]. ACE Team member Carlos Bordeu left comments on many torrent sites saying that ACE Team did not intend to stop the unlicensed downloading of ''Zeno Clash'', but rather implored downloaders to purchase the game if they enjoyed it.{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash Dev Tries Reasoning with Torrenters | url=http://kotaku.com/5237036/zeno-clash-dev-tries-reasoning-with-torrenters | last=Good | first=Owen |publisher=Kotaku | date=2 May 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}}{{cite web | title=Game Developer Flirts With Pirates on BitTorrent Sites | url=http://torrentfreak.com/game-developer-flirts-with-pirates-on-bittorrent-sites-090427/ | author=enigmax | publisher=TorrentFreak | date=27 April 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} ACE Team later claimed that their unique approach, while probably not changing the minds of potential infringers, accidentally generated press which helped to market the product. == Reception == {{Video game reviews | GR = 77.80% (PC)
75.46% (X360) | MC = 77/100 (PC)
74/100 (X360) | 1UP = A- | GameRev = B | GSpot = 6.5/10 | EuroG = 8/10 | IGN = 8.4/10.0 | VG = 8/10 }} The game received an aggregate score of 77/100 on [[Metacritic]] and 77.80% on [[GameRankings]].{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash for PC - GameRankings | url=http://www.gamerankings.com/pc/943087-zeno-clash/index.html | publisher=[[GameRankings]] | accessdate=5 November 2009}}{{cite web |title=Zeno Clash: Ultimate Edition Critic Reviews for Xbox 360 at Metacritic |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/zeno-clash |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=5 November 2009}} In January 2009, ''Zeno Clash'' was a nominated finalist in the [[Independent Games Festival]] yearly competition, in the category of Excellence in Visual Art. It was one of five games to be selected for this award, from a total of 226 participating titles.{{cite web | title=2009 Independent Games Festival Winners | url=http://www.igf.com/02finalists.html | publisher=[[Independent Games Festival]] | accessdate=5 November 2009}} It was named PC Game of the Month by [[IGN]] for April 2009. It was praised for its originality and "satisfying sense of combat."{{cite web | title=Game of the Month: April 2009 | url=http://games.ign.com/articles/977/977494p1.html | author=Staff | publisher=IGN | date=30 April 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} It was a finalist in the category of Best Debut in the Tenth Annual Game Developer Choice Awards.{{Cite web |url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/uncharted-2-flower-assassins-creed-ii-lead-finalists-for-the-tenth-annual-game-developers-choice-awards-82054972.html |publisher=[[PR Newswire]] |accessdate=31 January 2011 |date=19 January 2010 |title=Uncharted 2, Flower, Assassin's Creed II Lead Finalists for the Tenth Annual Game Developers Choice Awards}} It also won ''[[PC Gamer]]''{{'}}s 2009's Independent Game of the Year."PC Gamer" (March 2010) The gaming website [[Rock, Paper, Shotgun]] reviewed the game two days before its release, giving it four out of four thumbs up and highly recommending the title. ''Zeno Clash: Ultimate Edition'' was similarly received by critics, averaging 74/100 at Metacritic and 75.46% at GameRankings.{{cite web |title=Zeno Clash for Xbox 360 - GameRankings |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/xbox360/975437-zeno-clash-ultimate-edition/index.html |publisher=GameRankings |accessdate=14 December 2010}}{{cite web |title=Zeno Clash: Ultimate Edition Critic Reviews for Xbox 360 at Metacritic |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/zeno-clash-ultimate-edition | publisher=Metacritic |accessdate=14 December 2010}} Sales for ''Ultimate Edition'' are reported as being significantly lower than the PC version.{{Cite web |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/pc-crowd-more-open-to-weird-games |title=PC crowd "more open" to weird games |date=29 July 2010 |first=Robert |last=Purchese |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |accessdate=14 December 2010}} It did however place eighth in sales the week of its release{{Cite web |url=http://majornelson.com/archive/2010/05/11/live-activity-for-week-may-3rd.aspx |title=Live Activity for the Week of May 3rd |publisher=[[Larry Hryb|Major Nelson]] |first=Larry |last=Hyrb |date=11 May 2010 |accessdate=19 January 2011}} The unique visual design and story received high praise from most critics. The reviewers from Rock, Paper, Shotgun stated that while the art of the game was "really unusual to look at" they felt that the visuals were "something of a reward". [[Eurogamer]]'s Dan Pearson called the game's environments "lushly crafted and massively colourful".{{cite web| title = Zeno Clash Review | url =http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/zeno-clash-review|accessdate = 23 April 2009|date=22 April 2009|publisher=Eurogamer | first = Dan | last = Pearson }} Jamin Smith, reviewer for [[Videogamer.com]] felt that the "narrative that was (probably) conjured up during an intense drug induced trip."{{Cite web |url=http://www.videogamer.com/xbox360/zeno_clash_ultimate_edition/review.html |publisher=[[Videogamer.com]] |accessdate=20 January 2011 |title=Zeno Clash Ultimate Edition Review |first=Jamin |last=Smith |date=21 May 2010}} He went on to call the game world "incredibly cohesive" and stated that the story provided a perfect compliment to the atmosphere. Jason Ocampo of [[IGN]] remarked in his review that "thanks to smart design and storytelling, it feels refreshingly original and completely compelling."{{cite web | title=Zeno Clash Review | url=http://uk.pc.ign.com/articles/976/976395p1.html | last=Ocampo | first=Jason | publisher=IGN| date=24 April 2009 |accessdate=11 September 2009}} Reviewers were divided on gameplay aspects. [[1UP.com]]'s Scott Sharkey felt that the first-person fisticuffs were convincing when combined with camera motion; he compared such aspects to ''[[Mirror's Edge]]''.{{Cite web |url=http://www.1up.com/do/reviewPage?cId=3179150&p=4 |publisher=[[1UP.com]] |first=Scott |last=Sharkey |accessdate=20 January 2011 |date=5 May 2010 |title=Zeno Clash XBLA Review}} Eduardo Reboucas of [[Game Revolution]] felt that the trigger-based controls of the ''Ultimate Edition'' took some getting used to and that some encounters with enemies can occasionally become frustrating.{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/xbox360/zeno-clash-ultimate-edition |publisher=[[Game Revolution]] |accessdate=20 January 2011 |title=Zeno Clash Ultimate Edition - Xbox360 |date=13 May 2010 |first=Eduardo |last=Reboucas}} Jason Ocampo of IGN felt that the hand-to-hand combat was "a bit clumsy, but wholly satisfying at the same time." Brett Todd of [[GameSpot]] was less favorable, calling it "simplistic" and "monotonous," citing its lack of variety in gameplay.{{cite web| title = Zeno Clash Review | url=http://www.gamespot.com/pc/action/zenoclash/review.html|accessdate = 6 May 2009|date=22 May 2009|publisher=[[GameSpot]]| first = Brett | last = Todd }} {{clear}} == Sequel == {{main|Zeno Clash II}} On 19 May 2009 the developers announced that a sequel to ''Zeno Clash'' was in the works.{{cite web | title=Punch! Kick! Zeno Clash 2! | url=http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2009/05/19/11853/ | last=Walker | first=John | publisher=Rock, Paper, Shotgun | date=19 May 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} Ghat reprises his role as the protagonist, and several characters such as Father-Mother and Golem return.{{cite web | title=New Trailer & news about the sequel... | url=http://blogs.aceteam.cl/zenoclash/index.php?showentry=34 | last=Bordeu | first=Carlos | publisher=ACE Team | date=19 May 2009 | accessdate=5 November 2009}} ACE Team expressed a desire to incorporate elements of [[role-playing game]]s that were present in their previous abandoned project, ''Zenozoik''. == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{Commons category}} * {{Official website|zenoclash.com}} {{ACE Team}} [[Category:2009 video games]] [[Category:Atlus games]] [[Category:Beat 'em ups]] [[Category:Fantasy video games]] [[Category:First-person shooters]] [[Category:Indie video games]] [[Category:Source (game engine) games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Chile]] [[Category:Video games featuring anthropomorphic characters]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox 360 games]] [[Category:Xbox 360 Live Arcade games]] [[Category:Commercial video games with freely available source code]]
